alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Latimer; Le Flore (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Haskell, northeastern Latimer and central Le Flore Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 159 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 5 miles south of Fanshawe, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Poteau... Wister... Howe... Red Oak... Mccurtain... Fanshawe... Talimena State Park... Bengal... Mc Curtain... Lake Wister State Park... Lequire... Shady Point... Summerfield... Milton... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
